Parameter.Label: Alarm Cancellation Delay
Parameter.Help: Additional delay after an alarm has ceased. The parameter allows you to specify additional time, after which the alarm is cancelled once its violation has ceased.

Parameter.Label: Forced Level of Dimming group 1
Parameter.Help:
Value of the parameter specifying the forced level of dimming / opening sun blinds when comes "switch on" / "open" command to devices from association group no. 1.
In the case of alarm frames the alarm priority is specified. Possible parameter settings: (1 ï¿½ 99) and 255. Value of 255 makes it possible to activate the device when using the Dimmer module it means activating the device and setting it to the previous stored condition, e.g. when Dimmer is set to 30%, then deactivated, and then reactivated using command 255, it will automatically be set to the previous condition, i.e. 30%.

Parameter.Label: Alarm cancelling or turning a device off (Basic) command frame deactivation
Parameter.Help: Allows for deactivating device turn off and alarm cancellation functions for the devices assigned to 1-st association group

Parameter.Label: Interval between successive readings of temperature sensors
Parameter.Help: Interval between successive readings of temperature from all sensors connected to the device in seconds. Note: taking temperature readings from the sensor does not result in sending a temperature condition report to the central hub.

Parameter.Label: Transmitting the alarm or control frame broadcast mode
Parameter.Help:
Transmitting the alarm or control frame in "broadcast" mode (i.e. to all devices within range), information sent in this mode is not repeated by the mesh network.
NOTE: If the broadcast mode of information transmission is activated for a given channel, then transmission of information in singlecast mode to devices assigned to the association group of this channel is deactivated.
